Frame:Motion along a path

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss Motion along a path
Transcription
Description A moving entity starts out in one place and ends up in another, having traversed the distance between these places
Closest FrameNet Frame(s) Motion, Motion_directional, Motion_scenario
Maps to IARPA Source Concept(s)
Other aliases Translational motion, Directional motion
Comments A moving entity (the mover) starts out in one place (Source), and ends up in another place (Goal), having covered some space between these two (Path)

I removed the LU 'go' for now (11/7/2014), to help extraction. We can add it back later! (Oana)

Family Motion Frames, Movement frames, Directional movement frames, Translational motion frames, Moving entity frames
Tags
Type Cog, Composed
Cultural Scope universal
Cultural Information
Applicability English

Bindings:

source=Source path goal.source
path=Source path goal.path
goal=Source path goal.goal

speed=Motion.speed
direction=Motion.direction
landmark=Source path goal.landmark

Inferences

Description Alignment of motion x-schema stages and Source_Path-Goal locations: 1) when motion begins, mover is at Source location; 2) as motion proceeds, mover is at (series of) path locations; 3) when motion ends, mover is at Goal location.
Type
Description A single mover can only move along one path at a time. Therefore, motion along a given path means the mover is not following other alternative paths.
Type
Description The direction of the mover's motion determines which locations the mover will move to (including the Goal location).
Type
Description The mover's mass affects the speed of motion and/or the amount of energy needed for mover to move. For instance, if mass is increased (e.g. if 'burdens' are added), more energy is required.
Type

Relevant Lexical Units:

Metaphor Program Alias

Metaphors that use this frame:

as Target frame as Source frame
  • ACTION IS MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • ALTERNATIVE LEGISLATION IS ALTERNATIVE PATH
  • AMOUNT OF PROGRESS TOWARD ENACTING LEGISLATION IS DISTANCE MOVED ALONG A PATH
  • CAUSED INABILITY TO ACT IS PREVENTION OF MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • CHANGE IN MOOD IS VERTICAL MOVEMENT
  • CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION
  • CURRICULUM IS A FIXED PATH
  • DIFFICULTIES IN PROGRESSING THROUGH LIFE ARE IMPEDIMENTS TO MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • EASE OF ACTION IS EASE OF MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • GOVERNING ACTION IS MOTION
  • LEGISLATIVE ACTIVITY IS MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • LIFE IS A SEQUENCE OF MOTIONS
  • PROGRESS IS FORWARD MOTION ALONG A PATH
  • PROGRESSING THROUGH LIFE IS MOVING ALONG A PATH
  • SEQUENCE OF ACTIONS IS A SEQUENCE OF MOVEMENTS
  • TIME IS A LANDSCAPE THROUGH WHICH THE OBSERVER MOVES
  • VIRTUAL MOTION IS ACTUAL MOTION

There are various ways we might handle 'energy-related' parameters. The amount of energy might be handled as an x-schema resource and/or input. The source of energy could be another role in this frame (energy-source), which would be bound to the actor for self-propelled motion, and to an external Causer in the case of CausedMotion.
